com.ob1tech.CsvFileSorter.algorithms.sort

Class MinIndexedBinaryHeap<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ob1tech.CsvFileSorter.algorithms.sort.MinIndexedBinaryHeap<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Comparable value
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<T>

    public class MinIndexedBinaryHeap<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<T>
     MinIndexedBinaryHeap is a class means to use a priority index
 queue sorting on applied comparable values.
 Max complexity level is O(n)
 valueOf(int)                | O(1)
 pollMinKeyIndex()        | O(log(n))
 insert(Comparable)        | O(log(n))
 contains(int)                | O(1)
 delete(int)                | O(log(n))
 peekMinKeyIndex()        | O(1)
 peekMinValue()                | O(1)
 pollMinValue()                | O(log(n))
 update(int, Comparable)| O(log(n))
 
 Example: 
 VALUE = Comparable value
 KEY = entered order
 VALUE  | KEY
 2      | 0
 4      | 1
 5      | 2
 1      | 3
 values[]:[2,4,5,1]
 positionMap[]:[1,3,2,0] Example: the 2nd value (key=1) is at node 3
 inverseMap[]:[3,0,2,1] Example: at the 2nd node (node=1) the key is 0
 
 Tree:
                0(k=3,V=1)
                /       \
        1(k=0,V=2)      2(k=2,V=5)
        /
 3(k=1,V=4)
    Author:
    Tomer Madmon

    Based on code provided by: William Fiset, william.alexandre.fiset@gmail.com williamfiset data-structures at github

    • Field Detail

      • positionMap

        public final int[] positionMap
        The Position Map (positionMap) keeps the position of the node in the heap tree. It maps Key Indexes (key) to where the position of that key is represented in the priority queue in the domain [0, heapSize). See class notation values example. Example: the 2nd value (key=1) is at node 3

      • inverseMap

        public final int[] inverseMap
        The Inverse Map (inverseMap) keeps the positions of the keys in the node array. It stores the indexes of the keys in the range [0, heapSize) which make up the priority queue. It should be noted that 'inverseMap' and 'positionMap' are inverses of each other, so: positionMap[inverseMap[i]] = inverseMap[positionMap[i]] = i See class notation values example. Example: at the 2nd node (node=1) the key is 0

      • values

        public final java.lang.Object[] values
        The values associated with the keys. It is very important to note that this array is indexed by the key indexes (aka 'key'). The key is the same as the insertion order of values

    • Constructor Detail

      • MinIndexedBinaryHeap

        public MinIndexedBinaryHeap(int maxSize)
        Contractor: Initializes a binary heap with a maximum capacity of maxSize. Expected maxSize > 2 otherwise this sorting tool is useless. Error will occur if maxSize <= 0
        Parameters:
        maxSize - max heap size allowed for processing
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        See Also:
        IllegalArgumentException

        public boolean contains(int key)

        Returns:
        boolean true if heap has no elements

      • insert

        public void insert(T value)
        insert a new value to a non full heap. Full heap will throw an error
        Parameters:
        value - comparable value
        See Also:
        insert(int, Comparable)

      • insert

        public void insert(int key,
                   T value)
        insert value to a valid(Not occupied) key position and balance the heap to keep it as a min heap. The key will be added to the last node on the heap and then will be bubble(swim) up as needed.

        Errors will occur when:

        • Position is occupied
        • Value is null
        Parameters:
        value -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        See Also:
        contains(int), valueNotNullOrThrow(Object), swim(int)

      • valueOf

        public T valueOf(int key)
        Return the stored value at specified position of inserted values
        Parameters:
        key - The specified position in the values array
        Returns:
        the associated value
        See Also:
        keyExistsOrThrow(int)

      • delete

        public T delete(int key)
        Remove a value from the heap and make sure it is balanced again
        Parameters:
        key - The position of the value in the value array to be deleted
        Returns:
        The deleted value
        See Also:
        keyExistsOrThrow(int), swap(int, int), sink(int), swim(int)

      • update

        public T update(int key,
                T value)
        Update is used to change the position value. After the change the heap is re balanced
        Parameters:
        key - The position of the value in the value array to be updated
        value - The new value
        Returns:
        Old value
        See Also:
        keyExistsAndValueNotNullOrThrow(int, Object), sink(int), swim(int)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Print the value keys in the order of the binary tree nodes
